alert.note: Alert for Goshen (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 4:42PM MDT until June 14 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT FOR NORTHERN SCOTTS BLUFF...SOUTHERN SIOUX AND EAST CENTRAL GOSHEN COUNTIES... At 442 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Morrill, or 14 miles southeast of Torrington, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Scottsbluff, Gering, Mitchell, Terrytown, Morrill, Lyman, Lake Minatare Campground, Stegall, Scotts Bluff National Monument, Hubbard Hill, Scottsbluff Airport, Lake Minatare, Lake Alice and Henry. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
